input.name: in_features
input.title: Input Features
input.abstract: The input point, line, or polygon features to be buffered.

input.name: out_feature_class
input.title: Output Feature Class
input.abstract: The feature class containing the output feature buffers.

input.name: buffer_distance_or_field
input.title: Distance [value or field]
input.abstract: The distance around the input features in which buffer zones are created. Distances can be provided as either a value representing a linear distance or as a numeric field from the input features that contains the linear distances to buffer each feature.If the Distance linear units are not specified or are entered as Unknown, the linear unit of the input features' spatial reference is used.

input.name: line_side
input.title: Side Type
input.abstract: The side(s) of the input features that will be buffered.FULL—For line input features, buffers will be generated on both sides of the line. For polygon input features, buffers will be generated around the polygon and will contain and overlap the area of the input features. For point input features, buffers will be generated around the point. This is the default. LEFT—For line input features, buffers will be generated on the topological left of the line. This option is not valid for polygon input features.RIGHT—For line input features, buffers will be generated on the topological right of the line. This option is not valid for polygon input features.OUTSIDE_ONLY—For polygon input features, buffers will be generated only outside the input polygon (the area inside the input polygon will be erased from the output buffer). This option is not valid for line input features.

input.name: line_end_type
input.title: End Type
input.abstract: The shape of the buffer at the end of line input features. This parameter is not valid for polygon input features.

input.name: dissolve_option
input.title: Dissolve Type
input.abstract: Specifies the dissolve to be performed to remove output buffer overlap.

input.name: dissolve_field
input.title: Dissolve Field(s)
input.abstract: The list of field(s) from the input features on which to dissolve the output buffers. Any buffers sharing attribute values in the listed fields (carried over from the input features) are dissolved.

output.name: out_feature_class
output.title: Output Feature Class
output.abstract: The feature class containing the output feature buffers.

input.name: clip_features
input.title: Clip Features
input.abstract: The features used to clip the input features.

input.name: out_feature_class
input.title: Output Featureclass
input.abstract: The feature class to be created.

input.name: cluster_tolerance
input.title: XY Tolerance
input.abstract: The minimum distance separating all feature coordinates (nodes and vertices) as well as the distance a coordinate can move in X or Y (or both). Set the value to be higher for data with less coordinate accuracy and lower for data with extremely high accuracy.

output.name: out_feature_class
output.title: Output Feature Class
output.abstract: The feature class to be created.
